\chapter{Installation Guide}
\label{\detokenize{installation_guide:installation-guide}}\label{\detokenize{installation_guide::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To set up this project locally:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Clone the repository:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/Boissek123/coursework\PYGZus{}two.git
\PYG{n+nb}{cd}\PYG{+w}{ }coursework\PYGZus{}two
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Install Poetry (if not already installed):

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
curl\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}sSL\PYG{+w}{ }https://install.python\PYGZhy{}poetry.org\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{p}{|}\PYG{+w}{ }python3\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Install dependencies:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
poetry\PYG{+w}{ }install
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create a \sphinxtitleref{.env} file with the following variables:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
DEEPSEEK\PYGZus{}API=your\PYGZus{}deepseek\PYGZus{}api\PYGZus{}key

MINIO\PYGZus{}ENDPOINT=minio:9000
MINIO\PYGZus{}ACCESS\PYGZus{}KEY=ift\PYGZus{}bigdata
MINIO\PYGZus{}SECRET\PYGZus{}KEY=minio\PYGZus{}password
MINIO\PYGZus{}SECURE=false

DB\PYGZus{}NAME=fift
DB\PYGZus{}USER=postgres
DB\PYGZus{}PASSWORD=postgres
DB\PYGZus{}HOST=postgres
DB\PYGZus{}PORT=5439
SCHEMA\PYGZus{}NAME=csr\PYGZus{}reporting
TABLE\PYGZus{}NAME=company\PYGZus{}indicators
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Run the extraction pipeline:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
poetry\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }python\PYG{+w}{ }Main.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Database \& Post\sphinxhyphen{}processing

\sphinxAtStartPar
After extraction, three CSV\sphinxhyphen{}based scripts handle post\sphinxhyphen{}processing:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Data Cleaning ((\sphinxtitleref{data\_cleaning.py})): cleans and reshapes raw CSR indicators CSV:
\begin{quote}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
poetry\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }python\PYG{+w}{ }src/modules/output/data\PYGZus{}cleaning.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{quote}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Metadata Export \& Merge ((\sphinxtitleref{reports\_export.py})): exports and merges (\sphinxtitleref{company\_reports}) and (\sphinxtitleref{company\_static}) from Postgres:
\begin{quote}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
poetry\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }python\PYG{+w}{ }src/modules/output/reports\PYGZus{}export.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{quote}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Postgres Load ((\sphinxtitleref{db\_load.py})): creates schema/table and bulk\sphinxhyphen{}loads (\sphinxtitleref{csr\_indicators.csv}):
\begin{quote}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
poetry\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }python\PYG{+w}{ }src/modules/output/db\PYGZus{}load.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{quote}

\end{itemize}

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Once complete, the cleaned and validated CSR indicator data will be available in the (\sphinxtitleref{csr\_reporting.company\_indicators}) table in your Postgres database.

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Usage Instructions}
\label{\detokenize{usage_instructions:usage-instructions}}\label{\detokenize{usage_instructions::doc}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Run the extraction pipeline}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
poetry\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }python\PYG{+w}{ }Main.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This will:
\sphinxhyphen{} Connect to MinIO and stream CSR PDF reports
\sphinxhyphen{} Chunk each PDF into text blocks
\sphinxhyphen{} Query Deepseek API to extract indicator values
\sphinxhyphen{} Append results to \sphinxtitleref{logs/final\_output.csv}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Post\sphinxhyphen{}processing \& Data Cleaning}

\sphinxAtStartPar
After extraction, clean, merge and load your CSR data:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\alph}{enumii}{enumiii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Data Cleaning}: normalize and split values in the raw CSV:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
poetry\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }python\PYG{+w}{ }src/modules/output/data\PYGZus{}cleaning.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Metadata Export \& Merge}: export \sphinxtitleref{company\_reports} and \sphinxtitleref{company\_static} tables from Postgres and merge:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
poetry\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }python\PYG{+w}{ }src/modules/output/reports\PYGZus{}export.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Database Load}: create schema/table and bulk\sphinxhyphen{}load the cleaned CSV into Postgres:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
poetry\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }python\PYG{+w}{ }src/modules/output/db\PYGZus{}load.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{enumerate}

\end{enumerate}


\section{Troubleshooting Tips}
\label{\detokenize{usage_instructions:troubleshooting-tips}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Deepseek API errors}:
• Verify \sphinxtitleref{DEEPSEEK\_API} in your \sphinxtitleref{.env} is correct.
• Check your plan’s rate limits.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{MinIO connection issues}:
• Confirm \sphinxtitleref{MINIO\_ENDPOINT}, \sphinxtitleref{MINIO\_ACCESS\_KEY}, \sphinxtitleref{MINIO\_SECRET\_KEY} and \sphinxtitleref{MINIO\_SECURE} in \sphinxtitleref{.env}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Database connectivity}:
• Ensure Postgres is running and the \sphinxtitleref{DB\_*} credentials in \sphinxtitleref{.env} match your instance.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{No indicators extracted}:
• Inspect \sphinxtitleref{logs/final\_log.txt} for parsing warnings or failures.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Architecture Overview}
\label{\detokenize{architecture_overview:architecture-overview}}\label{\detokenize{architecture_overview::doc}}

\section{Data Flow}
\label{\detokenize{architecture_overview:data-flow}}
\sphinxincludegraphics[]{graphviz-48da6516d667b8b0c9b49eeccaa7def4f87c2745.pdf}


\section{Components}
\label{\detokenize{architecture_overview:components}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
src/modules/input/: Core extraction logic ((\sphinxtitleref{emissions\_parser.py}), (\sphinxtitleref{minio\_streaming\_extractor.py}), (\sphinxtitleref{indicator\_config.py}), (\sphinxtitleref{postprocess.py})).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
src/modules/db/data\_storage.py: Stores cleaned data into PostgreSQL ((\sphinxtitleref{csr\_reporting.company\_indicators})).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
src/modules/output/data\_clean.py: Cleans and reshapes raw extracted CSV into standardized format.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
src/modules/output/data\_export.py: Merges company metadata with report information for downstream use.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
config/indicators.yaml: Indicator definitions, aliases, and validation rules.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
logs/: Stores extraction output ((\sphinxtitleref{final\_output.csv})) and processing logs.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
PostgreSQL: Schema (\sphinxtitleref{csr\_reporting}), (\sphinxtitleref{table company\_indicators}), (\sphinxtitleref{alongside company\_reports}) and (\sphinxtitleref{company\_static}) for metadata.

\end{itemize}

\subparagraph{Module Contents}
\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/db/data_storage/index:module-contents}}\index{store\_clean\_data\_to\_postgres() (in module modules.db.data\_storage)@\spxentry{store\_clean\_data\_to\_postgres()}\spxextra{in module modules.db.data\_storage}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/db/data_storage/index:modules.db.data_storage.store_clean_data_to_postgres}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{modules.db.data\_storage.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{store\_clean\_data\_to\_postgres}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{cleaned\_csv\_path}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Store cleaned CSR indicator data into a PostgreSQL database.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This function reads a cleaned CSV file containing company sustainability indicators
and writes the data into a PostgreSQL table \sphinxtitleref{csr\_reporting.company\_indicators}.
If the table or schema does not exist, they will be created. If the table already exists,
the new data will be appended.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Environment variables must be set via a \sphinxtitleref{.env} file or system environment for:
\sphinxhyphen{} POSTGRES\_USER
\sphinxhyphen{} POSTGRES\_PASSWORD
\sphinxhyphen{} POSTGRES\_HOST
\sphinxhyphen{} POSTGRES\_PORT
\sphinxhyphen{} POSTGRES\_DB

\sphinxAtStartPar
The CSV file is expected to have the following columns (in order):
\sphinxhyphen{} company
\sphinxhyphen{} year
\sphinxhyphen{} annual\_carbon\_emissions\_tonnes\_co2
\sphinxhyphen{} annual\_carbon\_emissions\_reduction\_percent
\sphinxhyphen{} annual\_water\_use\_cubic\_meters
\sphinxhyphen{} annual\_water\_use\_reduction\_percent
\sphinxhyphen{} renewable\_energy\_use\_mwh
\sphinxhyphen{} sustainable\_materials\_ratio\_percent
\sphinxhyphen{} waste\_recycling\_rate\_percent
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cleaned\_csv\_path}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Path to the cleaned CSV file containing CSR indicator data.

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{psycopg2.Error}} \textendash{} If connection to the PostgreSQL database fails.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pandas.errors.EmptyDataError}} \textendash{} If the CSV file is empty or unreadable.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ValueError}} \textendash{} If column count or names in the CSV do not match expected schema.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\sphinxstepscope

\subparagraph{modules.input.emissions\_parser}
\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/input/emissions_parser/index:module-modules.input.emissions_parser}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/input/emissions_parser/index:modules-input-emissions-parser}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/input/emissions_parser/index::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!modules.input.emissions\_parser@\spxentry{modules.input.emissions\_parser}}\index{modules.input.emissions\_parser@\spxentry{modules.input.emissions\_parser}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Handles extraction of CSR indicators from PDF files using DeepSeek API.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Includes text parsing, relevance detection, DeepSeek querying, postprocessing, and CSV output.

\subsubsection{modules.output}
\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/index:module-modules.output}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/index:modules-output}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/index::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!modules.output@\spxentry{modules.output}}\index{modules.output@\spxentry{modules.output}!module@\spxentry{module}}

\paragraph{Submodules}
\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/index:submodules}}
\sphinxstepscope


\subparagraph{modules.output.data\_clean}
\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/data_clean/index:module-modules.output.data_clean}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/data_clean/index:modules-output-data-clean}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/data_clean/index::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!modules.output.data\_clean@\spxentry{modules.output.data\_clean}}\index{modules.output.data\_clean@\spxentry{modules.output.data\_clean}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This script processes CSR indicator data from multiple CSV files.
It performs the following steps:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Concatenates two sets of scraped CSR indicator data.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Cleans the report year column.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Cleans and standardizes renewable energy usage values.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Removes outliers and handles units for several CSR indicators.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Renames columns to include unit information.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Processes fractional columns (e.g., percentages) and removes values \textgreater{} 100.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Removes duplicate and invalid rows.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Saves the cleaned CSR indicators to a CSV file.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Standardizes company names by matching them with a standard company list,
using fuzzy matching with a configurable threshold.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Saves the final standardized company indicators to a CSV file.

\end{itemize}

{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{x}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Clean and standardize an energy usage value.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Attempts to convert a string representing energy usage to a standardized format with “MWh” as the unit.
If the value is expressed in GWh or TWh, it is converted into MWh.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x}} \textendash{} A value (string or numeric) representing the energy usage.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A string in the format “{[}numeric value{]} MWh”. If conversion fails, returns an empty string.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{match\_company() (in module modules.output.data\_clean)@\spxentry{match\_company()}\spxextra{in module modules.output.data\_clean}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/data_clean/index:modules.output.data_clean.match_company}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{modules.output.data\_clean.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{match\_company}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{name}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{choices}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{threshold}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{80}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Match a company name to a list of standard names using fuzzy string matching.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Uses fuzzywuzzy’s extractOne function to find the best match. If the score is above the threshold,
the best match is returned; otherwise, None is returned.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{name}} \textendash{} The company name to match.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{choices}} \textendash{} A list of standard company names.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{threshold}} \textendash{} An integer threshold for a valid match (default is 80).

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A matched company name if the similarity score exceeds the threshold; otherwise, None.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subparagraph{modules.output.data\_export}
\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/data_export/index:module-modules.output.data_export}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/data_export/index:modules-output-data-export}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/data_export/index::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!modules.output.data\_export@\spxentry{modules.output.data\_export}}\index{modules.output.data\_export@\spxentry{modules.output.data\_export}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This script connects to a PostgreSQL database, exports two tables as CSVs,
cleans and merges them based on company identifiers, and saves the merged output.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Steps:
1. Connects to PostgreSQL using environment variables via \sphinxtitleref{dotenv}.
2. Exports:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{csr\_reporting.company\_reports} to \sphinxtitleref{company\_reports.csv}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{csr\_reporting.company\_static} to \sphinxtitleref{company\_static.csv}

\end{itemize}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{2}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Cleans \sphinxtitleref{symbol} and \sphinxtitleref{security} columns to ensure consistent casing and whitespace.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Merges static metadata (\sphinxtitleref{company\_static}) with dynamic reports (\sphinxtitleref{company\_reports}) on symbol + security.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Drops duplicates and saves the final merged data as \sphinxtitleref{company\_information.csv}.

\end{enumerate}

\subparagraph{modules.output.data\_storage}
\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/data_storage/index:module-modules.output.data_storage}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/data_storage/index:modules-output-data-storage}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/modules/output/data_storage/index::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!modules.output.data\_storage@\spxentry{modules.output.data\_storage}}\index{modules.output.data\_storage@\spxentry{modules.output.data\_storage}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This script ensures the existence of a PostgreSQL table \sphinxtitleref{csr\_reporting.company\_indicators},
creates it if missing, and then loads data from \sphinxtitleref{company\_indicators.csv} into the table.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Workflow:
1. Connects to the PostgreSQL database using environment variables from \sphinxtitleref{.env}.
2. Checks if the schema and table exist using \sphinxtitleref{information\_schema}.
3. Creates the schema and table if they don’t exist.
4. Reads the cleaned CSR indicator data from a CSV file.
5. Standardizes column names for SQL compatibility.
6. Uses SQLAlchemy to insert the DataFrame into PostgreSQL using \sphinxtitleref{to\_sql}.
